item.title: Suspended Labour councillor Ricky Jones arrested after video shows him ‘urging people to cut throats’
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump says Kamala Harris' ex-boyfriend told terrible things about her
item.description: ​Former US president Donald Trump commented on Kamala Harris' past relationship with Willie Brown and said Willie told him terrible things about Kamala. Trump said he knew Willie Brown very well. "He told me terrible things about [Kamala]. He had a big part in what happened with Kamala... He was not a fan of hers very much at that point," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Tampon Tim is a badge of honor': Tim Walz supporters crush Megyn Kelly
item.description: Journalist Megyn Kelly made 'Tampon Tim', a nickname for Kamala Harris' running mate Tim Walz, trend on X but it mostly backfired as social media users said it is a badge of honor for the Minnesota Gov. Tim signed a bill last year requiring schools in the state to provide free menstrual products in all public school bathrooms. The bill said feminine hygiene products would be placed in boys' bathrooms as well -- which made Tim Walz a kind of laughing stock to the Republicans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says 'willing to debate Harris three times in September'; gives specific dates
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says 'we are close to a world war' in criticism of Kamala Harris, Tim Walz
item.description: Trump said he wants three debates with Kamala Harris but she can't debate and she is incompetent. "We were given Joe Biden and now we are given somebody else. And I think I would rather be running against somebody else. But that was their choice. Kamala's record is horrible, Trump said in a press conference Thursday at his residence. ​
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Zero tolerance for 'sin' of spreading anarchy: Pakistan army chief

item.title: Outpouring of support for Kamala Harris from Indian Americans, says her close aide Harini Krishnan
item.dc:creator: Ishani Duttagupta

item.title: 'F*****g Estonians': Labour MP Lauren Edwards apologises for offensive old tweets
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Queen for a king': Vivek Ramaswamy's jibe at Biden's 'no-work' schedule
item.description: Vivek Ramaswamy, the former Republican candidate for president, called President Joe Biden a ceremonial figure like a British monarch and said the Democrats are now trying to swap the king for a queen in November. The comment came as a reaction to n X post which highlighted how little Joe Biden is working this week.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​Next-gen war robots: Ukraine set to deploy 'BAD One' dogs for recon missions and mine detection
item.description: Ukraine could soon unleash robot dogs on its front lines, replacing soldiers for perilous missions like spying on Russian trenches or detecting mines.At a demonstration in an undisclosed part of Ukraine, the metallic dog known as model "BAD One" stood up, crouched, ran and jumped according to commands transmitted by its operator.Stealthy and agile, they could soon become an invaluable ally on the front line for an Ukrainian army that is short on manpower to repel the Russian invasion, its makers said.Low on the ground and therefore difficult to detect, the robot dogs can use thermal imaging to inspect enemy trenches or the inside of buildings in combat zones."We have surveillance soldiers who get sent on reconnaissance missions (who) are most of the time very highly trained people, very experienced people (and) always exposed to risks," said the operator who called himself "Yuri", as he showed it off to AFP journalists."This dog limits the risk for soldiers and increases operational capabilities. This is the core function of the dog," said the operator, who works for a British company providing military equipment.A more advanced model, known as "BAD Two" could not be shown for security reasons.The device used in the demonstration has a battery that powers it for around two hours.Useful for detecting mines or improvised explosive devices, the robot dog can also be used to carry up to seven kilos (15 pounds) of ammunition or medicines to hot spots on the battlefield."I can't say how many we deployed" in Ukraine, Yuri said, adding: "But it will have a significant impact on the operations and increase the safety of soldiers."And if the robot dogs were ever to fall into Russian hands, he said, an emergency switch allows the operator to erase all its data.

item.title: Fears for women's rights as Iraqi bill resurfaces
item.description: Iraq's proposed bill allowing citizens to choose between religious and civil authorities on family matters has sparked concerns about women's rights, underage marriage, and male dominance. Critics fear it would undermine the 1959 Personal Status Law, potentially allowing child marriages. Activists are planning protests against the bill, which is backed by conservative Shiite Muslim deputies.

item.title: Giant Marilyn Monroe statue in US to move after locals complain 'kids can see her ...'
item.description: After years of controversy, Palm Springs decided to relocate the 26-foot 'Forever Marilyn' statue, depicting Marilyn Monroe's iconic skirt scene. Locals' concerns, especially about children viewing her undergarments, led to this decision. According to a statement from Palm Springs Mayor Jeffrey Bernstein, the statue will be relocated to a "location to be determined in the Downtown Park."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump is asking friends how his campaign is performing: 'Unfair that I beat him and now...'
item.description: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump is now complaining relentlessly and grown increasingly upset about Kamala Harris' surging poll numbers and media coverage. According to a Washington Post report, Donald Trump told an ally last week on phone that it's unfair that he beat Joe Biden and now he has to beat Kamala Harris too. Trump is asking his friends how his campaign is performing, the report said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Stolen valor' row: Tim Walz said he carried weapons; 'When, which war,' JD Vance's counter
item.description: The military record of Kamala Harris' running mate Tim Walz came under scrutiny as his rival JD Vance said if one does not go to the war, then he can't claim that he served in the military. JD Vance said Tim Walz dropped out of the army and took retirement in 2005 before his unit was deployed in Iraq.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Let loose the dogs of war: Ukraine to deploy 'Bad One' along front lines
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Violence must stop: Indian-American Congressmen call for end to violence against Hindus in Bangladesh
item.description: ​​They have also called upon the incoming interim government's prime minister-designate, Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, to uphold the rule of law as he assumes power.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance was asked whether he knows what 'Kamabla' means. His reply is....
item.description: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald has a new nickname for Kamala Harris 'Kamabla' which made its first appearance on Monday in Trump's Truth Social post. "People cote with their STOMACH, and food is now at an all time high because of Kamabla/Biden INCOMPETENCE. With them in charge, IT WILL ONLY GET WORSE" -- this was the post. And it was not a typo as Kamala was Kamabla since then.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US weekly jobless claims fall more than expected in latest week
Trump will hold a news conference in his first public appearance since rival Harris picked Walz
item.description: Former President Donald Trump announced a press conference at Mar-a-Lago, marking his first public appearance after Kamala Harris became the Democratic presidential nominee with Tim Walz as her running mate. Trump, criticized Harris for not holding a news conference since her campaign launch, indicated his willingness to debate her in the forthcoming presidential debate.

item.title: Trump took a private flight with Project 2025 director in 2022, reveals new photo
item.description: Donald Trump has categorically denied having anything to do with controversial Project 2025 but the controversy is far from dying down as now a photo of Trump with Kevin Roberts, the president of Heritage Foundation has surfaced. Reports said Trump took a 45-minute private flight with Kevin Roberts, which was not reported earlier.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
